title: Massive delay at airport - 5 hours of waiting
text:
Airline lufthansa sold me a one hour transit at Frankfurt, i’ve never been there so i trusted the german airlines to know what they are doing. I shouldn’t have. The security check-in line was at least an hour long (so called speed lane). There were dozens of people there panicking because they were all missing there flight because of this. After i got through the security check-in the airline personel were acting like it was my fault, as if i chose this. They rescheduled my ticket and i got to wait 5 hours at the gate for my next flight. None of the personel felt responsible or got close to an apology.
I’m never flying with Lufthansa again.

title: Visit early!
text: Everyone in Athens will want to go to Akropolis, ofcourse. To enjoy it the most i advise you to get out of bed early and enter the site as soon as it opens. Then most of the tourist tours will not have started yet, so it will be less crowded. Head straight to the top, so you can enjoy the biggest temples first and you'll be able to get pictures without too many other tourists. You will not regret it. PS, bring as much water as you can, it's probably gonna be hot and it's quite a hike.

title: Over-stimulating culture of Osaka
text: Visit this place to get a taste of the over-stimulating streets of Osaka. It's loud, it's bright and it's crowded. This is Osaka.

title: Great views, very crowded, museum not that interesting
text: Osaka Castle is a must-see in Osaka. The Castle is quite big, to get there you have to cross Osaka Castle Park, which is also filled with interesting historical features. A great place to learn about the Winter Battle of Osaka. Inside of Osaka Castle is a museum, which was stuffed with visitors. Only visit this museum if you are really interested in the history of a certain warrior, whose name i've forgotten. If you're not interested, don't bother, you will only be irritated by how crowded it is. You can enjoy the visit to the Castle without the museum.

title: One of the bigger temple sites in Osaka
text: This place is one of the bigger temple sites in Osaka where you can actually enter the temple. If you time it right you will see the monk rituals, which was very interesting to watch. The site has multiple temples and buildings and there is a cafeteria where you can sit and have a calm lunch and a coffee. You'll have an average of two to 3 hour visit.

title: Spa World
text: Great place close to the center of Osaka where you can escape the busy streets for a day and relax your mind and body. A gym is included in the price so you can start your visit with a healthy work-out and after relax your muscles in a sauna. After relaxing you have the option to have lunch or dinner for a good price, and finish your day with a bubble bath and a dip in the cold pool. Definitely worth a day's visit.

title: Filled with Japanse restaurants
text: This area is definitely worth a visit, the streets are filled with japanese restaurants that are not too expensive, extended english menu's and a lot of options. This place has a restaurant where you have to catch your own fish with a rod before they cook it!

title: It's a led light sign
text: That's all it is, a ledlight sign, yeah interesting at first, but it;s still just a sign. Who knows what Glico is anyway?

title: Beautiful castle, nice view
text: Osaka Castle park is a beautiful location where you can escape the streetlights and heavy traffic for beautiful nature and a great view. The Castle is a beaut and the museum inside is also worth the price.

title: Must see
text: This is an iconic street, if you are going to Osaka, you are going to dotonbori. I made some friends in some bars in this area, had great streetfoods and this street is filled with street performers and surprising events.

title: Fun but not necessary
text: If you like old videogames this bar is a fun attraction. I found that the bar was pretty small, with only 4 or 5 game sets available. It's a fun way to meet other travellers, tourists and travellers were the only ones there though. It's a western way of entertainment but it's not the place to go if you want to experience local culture
place: PC and Retro Bar Space Station
